meanings.sent1: The man in the hospital waiting room was a groaners.
meanings.sent2: The groaners in the audience made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The groaners in the haunted house added to the spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a groaners after a long day at work.
meanings.sent5: The groaners at the comedy show were always ready to express their displeasure.

meanings.definition: Jokes or puns that are considered corny or unfunny.
meanings.sent1: The dad jokes he told were always groaners.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's groaners fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent3: Even the kids found his groaners to be eye-roll inducing.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt at humor turned into a series of groaners.
meanings.sent5: The groaners at the party made everyone cringe instead of laugh.

meanings.definition: A type of comedy that relies on predictable or overused punchlines.
meanings.sent1: The sitcom was full of groaners that everyone saw coming.
meanings.sent2: The stand-up routine was filled with groaners that failed to land.
meanings.sent3: The movie's groaners made the audience groan even louder.
meanings.sent4: The play's groaners left the audience disappointed and unamused.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's reliance on groaners made his act predictable and tiresome.
